definition: country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The rest of us wore rough tweeds and brogues.
sentences.chinese: 粗花呢衣服和鄉下人穿的結實皮鞋。

sentences.english: A hillbilly was visiting the big city for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 一個鄉下人第一次到大城市遊逛。

sentences.english: He rusticated himself so long that he has become an absolute country cousin.
sentences.chinese: 他定居鄉村很久，已變成十足的鄉下人了。

sentences.english: New DiscoveryA hillbilly was visiting the big city for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 一個鄉下人第一次到大城市遊逛。

sentences.english: A countryman from the state of Lu sent to king Song Yuangong two knots that were difficult to untie.
sentences.chinese: 魯國的一個鄉下人送給宋元公兩個難以解開的連環結。

sentences.english: Who ever heard of a fatalistic farmer?
sentences.chinese: 誰聽說過一個鄉下人是宿命論者？

sentences.english: A hillbilly was visiting the big city for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 有一個鄉下人第一次來到大城市。

sentences.english: New Discovery A hillbilly was visiting the big city for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 新發現一個鄉下人第一次到大城市遊逛。

sentences.english: A countryman once went to a town.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，一個鄉下人進城去。

sentences.english: If he fears the intellectual, he despises the boor.
sentences.chinese: 他對知識分子有戒心，但是更瞧不起鄉下人。

sentences.english: Her parents told her not to look down upon the hick.
sentences.chinese: 她父母叫她不要瞧不起鄉下人。

sentences.english: Spending the Spring Festival , country folks liked pasting down door-gods.
sentences.chinese: 過年時，鄉下人喜歡貼門神。

sentences.english: Only you rednecks are trying to find China as an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 只有你們這些鄉下人才會認爲中國是敵人。

sentences.english: Even the rednecks knows you are the biggest asshole.
sentences.chinese: 甚至連鄉下人都知道你是最大的混蛋。

sentences.english: That would most certainly tend to prejudice country-born people against him .
sentences.chinese: 這就必然使鄉下人對他抱有成見。

sentences.english: Her parents tell her not to look down upon countrymen.
sentences.chinese: 她父母叫她不要瞧不起鄉下人。

definition: to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
